result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra A Hayne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Debra A Hayne in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  6 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with:  victim listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Debra A Hayne in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  

Matter remains on the trial calendar.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing at 12-21-2015 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-05-2016 08:30 am.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Debra A Hayne in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
